intro: Reutera cervariifolia, commonly known as the silver fern, is a unique plant native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its striking, feathery foliage that resembles a fern, with silvery-white hairs covering the leaves. The plant has a compact growth habit and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in cool, moist environments and prefers well-drained soil. Reutera cervariifolia is a member of the Araliaceae family and is known for its slow growth and longevity.
